intro: Neoalsomitra philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine tamarind tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, sour fruits that are often used in local cuisines. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ecological and cultural significance, it is considered an important species in Philippine biodiversity.
